meanings.definition: A person who ducks or evades something.
meanings.sent1: The duckers quickly dodged the flying ball.
meanings.sent2: I saw the duckers hiding behind the tree.
meanings.sent3: The duckers played a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: She was a master of evasion, a true duckers in action.
meanings.sent5: The duckers skillfully avoided the incoming obstacle.

meanings.definition: The act of ducking or evading.
meanings.sent1: Duckers can help you avoid getting hit by a branch.
meanings.sent2: His quick duckers saved him from the falling object.
meanings.sent3: The duckers in the game were quite impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her duckers were like a dance, gracefully avoiding each obstacle.
meanings.sent5: Practice your duckers to stay safe in crowded places.

meanings.sent1: The group of duckers gathered to discuss their strategies.
meanings.sent2: I counted five duckers in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The duckers waddled around the park, drawing attention.
meanings.sent4: The duckers stood out among the other birds, proud and unique.
meanings.sent5: The duckers quacked happily as they swam in the pond.
